channel.title: Comments on: Excel 2010 Data Source “From Microsoft Query” Missing DSNs
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: genomon
item.dc:creator: genomon
item.description: Thanks, Jes! Had this problem in Access as well.
item.content:encoded: Thanks, Jes! Had this problem in Access as well.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: Confirmed that 64 bit Excel can see 64 bit DSN
item.content:encoded: Confirmed that 64 bit Excel can see 64 bit DSN

item.title: By: Jes Schultz Borland (grrlgeek)
item.dc:creator: Jes Schultz Borland (grrlgeek)
item.description: Denis, you're correct. Thanks for pointing that out.
item.content:encoded: Denis, you’re correct. Thanks for pointing that out.

item.title: By: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.dc:creator: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.content:encoded:
I have Excel 2010 64 bit. I’ll test later tonight if I can access 64 bit DSN.

BTW, took me quite a while to find the About dialog.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: Keep in mind that Excel 2010 comes in a 32 bit as well as a 64 bit version. I will check later today at home where I do have a 64 bit version of office 2010 installed to see if I see the DSN
item.content:encoded: Keep in mind that Excel 2010 comes in a 32 bit as well as a 64 bit version. I will check later today at home where I do have a 64 bit version of office 2010 installed to see if I see the DSN
